meanings.definition: In a manner that seeks to make amends or reconcile
meanings.sent1: She apologized atoningly for forgetting her friend's birthday.
meanings.sent2: He atoningly tried to repair the broken vase.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail atoningly after chewing on the slipper.
meanings.sent4: The sun atoningly peeked through the clouds after a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The child atoningly offered a hug to make up for spilling the juice.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows an attempt to make up for wrongdoing
meanings.sent1: She atoningly returned the book she had borrowed without asking.
meanings.sent2: He atoningly helped his sister clean up the mess he had made.
meanings.sent3: The cat atoningly brought a mouse as a gift to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The flowers atoningly bloomed after a harsh winter.
meanings.sent5: The student atoningly confessed to cheating on the test.
